Key Arguments: The proposed bill will erode the fundamental human right of freedom of speech.
Freedom of speech is essential for discovering truth and allowing free-flowing information to be tested and questioned.
The bill could halt essential dialogue and debate, which are necessary for societal progress.
The internet serves as a modern 'town square' for debate, and government should not be the arbiter of truth.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is the bedrock of a free and fair society.
The proposed bill will effectively halt this essential dialogue.
Setting up the government as the arbiter of truth is not the answer.
